page.title: 18ARTS & CRAFTS GARTMORE
page.content: Mr Cairney started{polishing stones about twenty years ago. He finds some on beaches where they have been washed down from the hills, and buys stones from abroad from a rock shop. Single stones take about one and a half hours from cutting to the final polish, but a batch of several hundred stones in a drum can take up to 8 weeks. Some of the polished stones are made into cuff-links, brooches, rings, pendants, bracelets, and earrings and sold as "Gartmore Gems". Mr Abernethy started his hobby when he saw a Special Austin Seven car. He now has a large garage where he makes his cars. The first one was a Chummy, which he later swapped for a purple Cup model which a friend had made. He has made about 5 cars. He thinks Gartmore is a good place for{Vintage {Cars,}as a lot of people have them.
